Literature Review: In recent years, the integration of nonlinear dynamics into macro-finance models has gained significant attention due to its ability to capture complex economic phenomena, such as systemic risk, endogenous jump risk, and financial constraints. This literature review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of macro-finance models with nonlinear dynamics, focusing on models that incorporate funding liquidity constraints, market liquidity frictions, and bank run frictions. We also discuss the empirical evidence supporting these models and the challenges associated with their implementation and estimation.
